snippet: Faculty members and students at the Sensory Ethnography Lab at Harvard are trying to create films that reflect the messiness of life.
abstract: Faculty members and students at the Sensory Ethnography Lab at Harvard University are trying to create films that reflect the messiness of life, straddling academia and the craft of documentary filmmaking with an art house sensibility; Leviathan, a new film by Verena Paravel and Lucien Castaing-Taylor, is perhaps the most radical work yet to emerge from the lab.
lead_paragraph: Faculty members and students at the Sensory Ethnography Lab at Harvard are trying to create films that reflect the messiness of life.

headline.main: The Merger of Academia and Art House
